title: Mac air to new mac air transfer of firefox
content:
'i bought a new mac air. The Genius Bar did not transfer firefox from my old mac air to my new one. i was on chat for an hour with apple support last night and they could not get it down. Right now, safari is working ok on the new mac air but my wife wants firefox because i guess she has a bunch of bookmarks and other things stored there. plus a history, i guess. The message from firefox on the new mac air reads "we're having trouble getting your pages back". Firefox seems go be working well on the old mac air.

also since we took her mac air to the Genius Bar, she has not been able to receive emails. they are locked down on the Monday Genius so-called worked on the migration/
creator: neddad

title: Firefox and Mac OS integration issues
content:
I'm using the latest Mac Catalina OS and the latest Firefox 84.0.1 but am suddenly not able to access the Washington Post web site, my Yahoo email, and Slate magazine sites -- all my other bookmarks work. If I use Safari on my desktop system, I can access those WaPo/Yahoo/Slate sites.

I've launched Firefox in safe mode and reinstalled Firefox. I still have the same problem.

What would cause this and how can it be fixed --could it be related to the Nashville bombing? Firefox and the newest Mac OS have been an ongoing problem since the Mojave OS. It's as if Apple has intentionally crippled Firefox to force people to use Safari. I'm sorry I had to upgrade the OS...it's been a pain.
creator: bijom

title: Google site issues
content:
Hi all. I've noticed that recently a number of Google sites fail to load or load very slowly in Firefox (84.0.1 - 64 bit). Specifically: - photos.google.com: continually prompted with "A web page is slowing down your browser. What would you like to do?" with the options "Stop it" or "Wait". I continually choose Wait but I never get to see the photos. (FYI on my Android mobile it works just fine.) - mail.google.com (or gmail.com): sometimes it doesn't load at all and I need to quit the tab (usually pinned) and start a new tab.

I'm not sure if these issues are related from the browser side, but they have both become very annoying. I haven't seen such issues with other sites.

Sincerely. Eddy

I think the laptop froze and after a while restarted. I restarted firefox, version 83, hoping that "restore session" would kick in but unfortunately nothing like that happened. I've tried different things but not succeded. I also managed to update the browser to the latest version (84.0.1). Is there a way i could recover all sessions and bookmarks etc and how as that is really important to me? Thanks in advance for your help. Tom

title: Can't donwnload some files when using web proxy (works with other browsers)
content:
Hi all,

I'm struggling with certain downloads and Firefox when using a web proxy. The proxy settings are done in Windows 10 and Firefox is set to use system proxy settings. Users are authenticated automatically at the proxy using kerberos (Windows AD environment)


On the proxy (Squid) I can see the failing files downloaded and I can download these files being transferred to firefox via the proxy port when doing packet capture. Nearly all sites and services work. Only some are affected. When using other browsers (MS IE, MS Edge, Chrome) these downloads work perfectly. When disabling Proxy on Firefox these downloads work, too. Only with this combination Firefox + Proxy I get some failures.

This is one example (that's a PDF datasheet): https://www.ergoswiss.com/de/services/cad-hydraulikhubsysteme/pumpen/pumpe-pf-3-4-anschluesse/?tx_downloads_downloadscategory%5Bdownload%5D=1753&tx_downloads_downloadscategory%5Baction%5D=download&tx_downloads_downloadscategory%5Bcontroller%5D=Download&cHash=9351869892df2bd6c6fbebbd2e74e862

And this is the error message Firefox gives me: C:\Users\[changed for privacy]\AppData\Local\Temp\64gqW0kX.pdf.part could not be saved, because the source file could not be read. Try again later, or contact the server administrator

Again this works in Firefox without proxy and It works in the three other browsers with and without proxy. And only few files are affected. Besides checking logs and doing packet capture I'm running out of ideas. Where do I continue troubleshooting?

Firefox 84.0.1 Windows 10 Pro 1909 x64
creator: michael.steffens

title: This new politically correct lexicon causes problems and solves nothing
content: This is absolutely ridiculous, Mozilla. I was going through the privacy settings on Firefox today and was reading about "primary password" to see if it is a feature I might want to use to control my passwords. NOT control people. Just passwords. And then I saw it. This inane explanation that the word "master" somehow perpetuates racism. This is NOT true. The term master, like every word in the dictionary, has multiple meanings in multiple contexts. In the context of passwords, it in no way, shape, or form "perpetuates racism" or "exclude" or "damage" people. We are talking about passwords! Do you know what DOES damage people and promote unnecessary awkwardness among people?? Garbage like this. Trying to surgically change normal, everyday words and impute some dark, sinister, nefarious, or otherwise negative meaning to perfectly innocent words and forms of expression with absolutely zero tie-in to past historical phenomena that occurred across the entire globe. This constant word policing causes more damage, more hurt feelings, more social strife, because it puts everyone on eggshells, constantly worried that the slightest utterance of a syllable is going to be taken the wrong way and used to accuse innocent people of horrible and unthinkable malice. This is a very WRONG approach to take, Mozilla. You are perpetuating and exacerbating ignorance and tension where no tension should be present. You are part of the problem, not the solution.
creator: iploya
